semantic_title: Chronic Disease Coding in Outpatient Settings

content.full_text: Chronic diseases treated on an ongoing basis may be coded and reported as many times as the patient receives treatment and care for the condition(s). (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)
content.summary: Allows repeated coding of chronic diseases for each encounter where treatment and care are provided (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)
key_concepts: Chronic diseases may be coded repeatedly (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)
Applies when patient receives treatment and care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L78)
Based on ongoing treatment basis (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code chronic diseases each time patient receives treatment and care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: Chronic conditions that are actively managed or treated during an encounter should be coded for that encounter (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine if treatment or care provided for each condition
Step 3: Code conditions that received treatment or care
Step 4: Consider impact on current encounter
Step 5: Include in coding for current visit

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with diabetes and hypertension presents for routine management of both conditions
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient here for routine follow-up of diabetes and hypertension. Blood pressure well controlled. Diabetes management reviewed, medication adjusted.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify chronic diseases - diabetes, hypertension
Step 2: Confirm treatment/care provided for both
Step 3: Code both conditions for this encounter
Step 4: Sequence based on encounter focus
Step 5: Include both in current visit coding

correct_coding.sequencing: Based on primary focus of encounter
correct_coding.rationale: Chronic diseases receiving treatment and care may be coded for each encounter (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should code all chronic conditions receiving care
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not coding all chronic conditions addressed in encounter

warnings: Only code chronic diseases when treatment or care is provided
best_practices: Code chronic diseases each time they receive treatment (Evidence: pg no: 114, L77-L78)
Include monitoring and medication management as care
common_mistakes: Not coding chronic conditions that are actively managed
Coding chronic conditions not addressed in current encounter
tips: Ongoing treatment includes monitoring and medication management
implementation_notes: Requires clear documentation of condition management
May impact quality measures and risk adjustment
clinical_context: Chronic disease management is ongoing process
